notes.text:
An update is now available for Red Hat Ceph Storage 3.2.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Ceph Storage is a scalable, open, software-defined storage platform that combines the most stable version of the Ceph storage system with a Ceph management platform, deployment utilities, and support services.

Security Fix(es):

* grafana: File exfiltration (CVE-2018-19039)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Bug Fix(es) and Enhancement(s)

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Ceph
Storage 3.2 Release Notes available at:

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_ceph_storage/3.2/html/release_notes/index
notes.title: Details

notes.title: Terms of Use

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat offerings.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat Ceph Storage 3.2 security, bug fix, and enhancement update

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: Grafana before 5.2.0-beta1 has XSS vulnerabilities in dashboard links.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: grafana: Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in dashboard links
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: grafana: Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in dashboard links

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: A security issue was found that could allow any users with Editor or Admin permissions in Grafana to read any file that the Grafana process can read from the filesystem. However, in order to exploit this issue you would need to be logged in to the system as a legitimate user with Editor or Admin permissions.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
